intro: Dyschoriste vestita, commonly known as the white-flowered dyschoriste, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
